de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.filterable

Class AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType extends AbstractExpandableListDecorator<GroupType,ChildType>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • BaseExpandableListAdapter
      • de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.AbstractExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
        • de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.enablestate.AbstractEnableStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
          • de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.itemstate.AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
            • de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.sortable.AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
              • de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.filterable.AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
  • Type Parameters:
    GroupType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's group items
    ChildType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's child items
    DecoratorType - The type of the decorator, which allows to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the group and child items of the adapter
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Adapter<ExpandableListView>, DataStructure, Parameterizable, Restorable, ExpandableGridViewAdapter, EnableStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, ExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, ItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, Loggable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractSelectableExpandableListAdapter, ExpandableListAdapterImplementation

    public abstract class AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType extends AbstractExpandableListDecorator<GroupType,ChildType>>
extends AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
implements FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    An abstract base class for all adapters, whose underlying data is managed as a filterable list of arbitrary group and child items. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a ExpandableListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Creates a new adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a filterable list of arbitrary group and child items.

      • AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter

        protected AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter(@NonNull
                                                  Context context,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  DecoratorType decorator,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  LogLevel logLevel,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  MultipleChoiceListAdapter<Group<GroupType,ChildType>> groupAdapter,
                                                  boolean allowDuplicateChildren,
                                                  boolean notifyOnChange,
                                                  boolean triggerGroupExpansionOnClick,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  java.util.Set<ExpandableListAdapterItemClickListener<GroupType,ChildType>> itemClickListeners,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  java.util.Set<ExpandableListAdapterItemLongClickListener<GroupType,ChildType>> itemLongClickListeners,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  java.util.Set<ExpandableListAdapterListener<GroupType,ChildType>> adapterListeners,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  java.util.Set<ExpansionListener<GroupType,ChildType>> expansionListeners,
                                                  boolean setChildEnableStatesImplicitly,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  java.util.Set<ExpandableListEnableStateListener<GroupType,ChildType>> enableStateListeners,
                                                  int numberOfGroupStates,
                                                  int numberOfChildStates,
                                                  boolean triggerGroupStateOnClick,
                                                  boolean triggerChildStateOnClick,
                                                  boolean setChildStatesImplicitly,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  java.util.Set<ExpandableListItemStateListener<GroupType,ChildType>> itemStateListeners,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  java.util.Set<ExpandableListSortingListener<GroupType,ChildType>> sortingListeners,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  java.util.Set<ExpandableListFilterListener<GroupType,ChildType>> filterListeners)
        Creates a new adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a filterable list of arbitrary group and child items.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the adapter belongs to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        decorator - The decorator, which should be used to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the group and child items of the adapter, as an instance of the generic type DecoratorType. The decorator may not be null
        logLevel - The log level, which should be used for logging, as a value of the enum LogLevel. The log level may not be null
        groupAdapter - The adapter, which should manage the adapter's group items, as an instance of the type MultipleChoiceListAdapter. The adapter may not be null
        allowDuplicateChildren - True, if duplicate child items, regardless from the group they belong to, should be allowed, false otherwise
        notifyOnChange - True, if the method notifyDataSetChanged():void should be automatically called when the adapter's underlying data has been changed, false otherwise
        triggerGroupExpansionOnClick - True, if a group's expansion should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
        itemClickListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been clicked by the user, as an instance of the type Set, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        itemLongClickListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been long-clicked by the user, as an instance of the type Set, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        adapterListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been modified, as an instance of the type Set, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        expansionListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when a group item has been expanded or collapsed, as an instance of the type Set, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        setChildEnableStatesImplicitly - True, if the enable states of children should be also set, when the enable state of the group, they belong to, is set
        enableStateListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item has been disabled or enabled, as an instance of the type Set, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        numberOfGroupStates - The number of states, the adapter's group items may have, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1
        numberOfChildStates - The number of states, the adapter's child items may have, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1
        triggerGroupStateOnClick - True, if the state of a group item should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
        triggerChildStateOnClick - True, if the state of a child item should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
        setChildStatesImplicitly - True, if the states of children should be also set, when the state of the group, they belong to, is set, false otherwise
        itemStateListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the state of an item has been changed, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        sortingListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        filterListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been filtered, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified

        Returns:
        A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been filtered, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified

      • isFiltered

        public final boolean isFiltered()
        Description copied from interface: FilterableExpandableListAdapter
        Returns, whether at least one filter is currently applied on the adapter to filter its group or child items, or not.
        Specified by:
        isFiltered in interface FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Returns:
        True, if at least one filter is currently applied on the adapter to filter its group or child items, false otherwise.

      • applyGroupFilter

        @Nullable
public final java.util.List<GroupType> applyGroupFilter(@NonNull
                                                                  java.lang.String query,
                                                                  int flags)
        Description copied from interface: FilterableExpandableListAdapter
        Filters the adapter's group items by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. If the underlying data of the adapter's group items does not implement the interface Filterable a FilteringNotSupportedException will be thrown. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered group item to be filtered once more.
        Specified by:
        applyGroupFilter in interface FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Parameters:
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the group items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the group items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        Returns:
        A list, which contains the group items, which have been filtered, as an instance of the type List, or null, if the filter has not been applied

      • applyGroupFilter

        @Nullable
public final java.util.List<GroupType> applyGroupFilter(@NonNull
                                                                  java.lang.String query,
                                                                  int flags,
                                                                  @NonNull
                                                                  Filter<GroupType> filter)
        Description copied from interface: FilterableExpandableListAdapter
        Filters the adapter's group items by using a specific query and a filter, which is used to apply the query on the single group items, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered group items to be filtered once more.
        Specified by:
        applyGroupFilter in interface FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Parameters:
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the group items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the group items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        filter - The filter, which should be used to apply the given query on the adapter's group items, as an instance of the type Filter. The filter may not be null
        Returns:
        A list, which contains the group items, which have been filtered, as an instance of the type List, or null, if the filter has not been applied

      • resetGroupFilter

        public final boolean resetGroupFilter(@NonNull

      • applyChildFilter

        public final java.util.List<ChildType> applyChildFilter(@NonNull
                                                        java.lang.String query,
                                                        int flags)
        Description copied from interface: FilterableExpandableListAdapter
        Filters the adapter's child items, regardless of the group they belong to, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Filterable a FilteringNotSupportedException will be thrown. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child item to be filtered once more.
        Specified by:
        applyChildFilter in interface FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Parameters:
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the child items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        Returns:
        A list, which contains the child items, which have been filtered, as an instance of the type List, or null, if the filter has not been applied

      • applyChildFilter

        @Nullable
public final java.util.List<ChildType> applyChildFilter(boolean filterEmptyGroups,
                                                                  @NonNull
                                                                  java.lang.String query,
                                                                  int flags)
        Description copied from interface: FilterableExpandableListAdapter
        Filters the adapter's child items, regardless of the group they belong to, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Filterable a FilteringNotSupportedException will be thrown. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child item to be filtered once more.
        Specified by:
        applyChildFilter in interface FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Parameters:
        filterEmptyGroups - True, if groups, which become empty by filtering their children, should be filtered as well, false otherwise
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the child items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        Returns:

                                                                  java.lang.String query,
                                                                  int flags)
        Description copied from interface: FilterableExpandableListAdapter

        @Nullable
public final java.util.List<ChildType> applyChildFilter(@NonNull
                                                                  java.lang.String query,
                                                                  int flags,
                                                                  @NonNull
                                                                  Filter<ChildType> filter)
        Description copied from interface: FilterableExpandableListAdapter
        Filters the adapter's child items, regardless of the group they belong to, by using a specific query and a filter, which is used to apply the query on the single child items, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child items to be filtered once more.
        Specified by:
        applyChildFilter in interface FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>

        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null

        Returns:
        A list, which contains the child items, which have been filtered, as an instance of the type List, or null, if the filter has not been applied on any group

        A set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter any of the adapter's child items, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no filters are currently applied on the adapter's child items

      • getChildFilterQueries

        public final java.util.Set<? extends FilterQuery> getChildFilterQueries(int groupIndex)
        Description copied from interface: FilterableExpandableListAdapter
        Returns a set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index.
        Specified by:
        getChildFilterQueries in interface FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the queries, which should be returned, have been applied on, as Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        A set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter the child items, which belong to the given group, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no filters are currently applied on the child items of the given group

      • getChildFilterQueries

        public final java.util.Set<? extends FilterQuery> getChildFilterQueries(GroupType group)
        Description copied from interface: FilterableExpandableListAdapter
        Returns a set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter the child items of a specific group.
        Specified by:
        getChildFilterQueries in interface FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the queries, which should be returned, have been applied on, as instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        A set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter the child items, which belong to the given group, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no filters are currently applied on the child items of the given group
